urls.title: May We Suggest at Hoole Bank. |
urls.description: ‚ÄòAt Hoole Bank, a clay pit excavated in Pleistocene till was utilised for hazardous waste disposal prior to 1967. At least 62 000 t of liquid acid tar was poured directly into the pit together with spent bentonite containing absorbed oil. Numerous chemical drums were also dumped in the sludge. The unlined acid tar lagoon occupies 1.1 ha, ranges up to 9 m deep and is underlain by mixed glacial deposits over red sandstone bedrock of Permo-Triassic Chester Pebble Beds Formation. The heterogeneous tar waste
